Util¶

class webgme_bindings.util.Util(webgme)[source]¶

Bases: object

Contains useful utility functions outside of the core and project API.

META(node, namespace=None)[source]¶

Gathers the and returns the meta nodes in the core tree associated with the node. If a namespace is supplied, only meta-nodes part of the corresponding library are returned.

Note that the names are fully-qualified (relative the provided namespace).

Parameters

  • node (dict) –

  • namespace (str) –

Returns

Dictionary where keys are the names of the meta-nodes (the equivalent of the native plugin.META)

Return type

dict

Raises

  • JSError – The result of the execution.

  • CoreIllegalArgumentError – If the supplied node is of wrong format

equal(node1, node2)[source]¶

Checks if two node dicts represent the same node. :param node1: :type node1: dict :param node2: :type node2: dict :return: True if the nodes are equal :rtype: bool

property gme_config¶

A nested dictionary with configuration parameters for webgme.

save(root_node, commit_hash, branch_name=None, msg='Save initiated from python api.')[source]¶

Persists the core tree from root node and makes a commit to the database. This method is short-hand for (but does not send all persisted objects over zeromq):

persisted = webgme.core.persist(root_node)

webgme.project.make_commit(branch_name, [commit_hash], persisted['rootHash'], persisted['objects'], msg)

Parameters

  • root_node (dict) – root of core tree that should be persisted and committed.

  • commit_hash (str) – commit-hash from where the now mutated root node came from

  • branch_name (str) – Name of branch to update (will only insert a commit if not given).

  • msg (str) – Commit message.

Returns

Status about the commit and branch update (same as project.makeCommit)

Return type

dict

Raises

  • JSError – The result of the execution.

  • CoreIllegalArgumentError – If the supplied root_node is of wrong format

traverse(node, visitor_fn)[source]¶

Traverses the sub-tree starting from node and invokes visitor_fn with each encountered node (including the passed in node).

Parameters

  • node (dict) – The root-node of the subtree to traverse.

  • visitor_fn (function) – The function invoked at each encountered node.

Returns

Nothing is returned by the function.

Return type

None

Raises

  • CoreIllegalArgumentError – If some of the parameters don’t match the input criteria.

  • CoreIllegalOperationError – If the context of the operation is not allowed.

  • CoreInternalError – If some internal error took place inside the core layers.

unload_root(node)[source]¶

Removes the reference to the root node associated with the node inside the corezmq.js module allowing the tree to be garbage collected. This should typically not be needed as the typical usage of the bindings is to load and work with one (or two roots) and then terminate the corezmq.js server.

Parameters

node (dict) – any node in a core tree

Returns

Nothing is returned by the function.

Return type

None

Raises

JSError – The result of the execution.
